Strompris API documentation¶

Fetch data from https://www.hvakosterstrommen.no/strompris-api and visualize it using various methods.

strompris.fetch_day_prices(date: date = None, location: str = 'NO1') → DataFrame¶

Fetch one day of data for one location from hvakosterstrommen.no API

Parameters:

  • date (datetime.date) – The date to be requested to the API.

  • location (str) – The location string for the desired area.

Returns:

A panda Dataframe containg two colums:

NOK_per_kWh (float): the cost of the gas at a specific date and time time_start (datetime.date): the day of the associated data

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

strompris.fetch_prices(end_date: date = None, days: int = 7, locations: list[str] = ('NO1', 'NO2', 'NO3', 'NO4', 'NO5')) → DataFrame¶

Fetch prices for multiple days and locations into a single DataFrame

Parameters:

  • end_date (datetime.date) – The last date that we want to be requested

  • days (int) – The number of days from the end_date we want to request

  • location (str) – The location string for the desired area.

Returns:

A panda Dataframe containg four colums:

NOK_per_kWh (float): the cost of the gas at a specific date and time time_start (datetime.date): the day of the associated data location_code (string): Code for the location location (string): full name for the location

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

strompris.plot_prices(df: DataFrame) → Chart¶

Plot energy prices over time

x-axis is time_start y-axis is price in NOK each location has its own line

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) – A panda Dataframe containg four colums: NOK_per_kWh (float): the cost of the gas at a specific date and time time_start (datetime.date): the day of the associated data location_code (string): Code for the location location (string): full name for the location

Returns:

The Chart object created, which describes the plot of the given data

Return type:

alt.chart

strompris.plot_activity_prices(df: DataFrame, activity: str = 'shower', minutes: float = 10) → Chart¶

Plot price for one activity by name, given a data frame of prices, and its duration in minutes.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – A panda Dataframe containg four colums: NOK_per_kWh (float): the cost of the gas at a specific date and time time_start (datetime.date): the day of the associated data location_code (string): Code for the location location (string): full name for the location

  • activity (str) – The name of the activity

  • minutes (float) – The duration of the activity in minutes

Returns:

The Chart object created, which describes the plot of the given data

Return type:

alt.chart
